result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Anthony Graham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: case 18CF803.  Huber release to be determined by HOC.

miscConds.notes: Restitution sert at $586.99. To  be paid first to victim C.A.G.

Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees, restitution and assessments including DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Obtain/maintain full time and/or part time employment/schooling or combination of both.

No new law violations.
No alcohol or illegal drugs.
No drug paraphernalia.
No contact with drug dealers/users.
No contact with C.G. or girlfriend for the duration of probation unless approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalzyers.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED: To be used as determined by agent if defendant is not complying to the conditions of probation.

charges.descr: Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis Anthony Graham

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Jason Findling
Victim Restitution Form.  Received and Filed.  nk
Victim Impact Statement.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Curtis A Graham in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Curtis A Graham in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, Huber release to be determined by HOC, concurrent to case 18CF803, with credit for 3 days served.  Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No new law violations. 
-Serve 30 DAYS in HOC as Condition Time; to be use as determined by agent if defendant is not complying to the conditions of probation; Court IMPOSED AND STAYED.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; NO ALCOHOL or ILLEGAL DRUGS; urine screens and breathalyzers once per month.
-Notify agent when prescribed medication.
-No drug paraphernalia.
-No contact with drug dealer/users.
-No contact with C.G. or girlfriend for the duration of probation unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain full time and/or part time employment/schooling or combination of both.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $586.99 to be paid first to victim C.A.G.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, restitution and assessments, including DNA surcharge, to be paid during the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Character Letter from Alan J.  Received and Filed.  nk
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Received and Filed.  nk
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Received and Filed.  nk
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed. nk
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Curtis Anthony Graham not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25. Branch 25 will accept 18CF803 from Branch 21 for global resolution. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Curtis Anthony Graham in court with Attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Curtis Anthony Graham in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Doxtator.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Curtis Anthony Graham in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Curtis Anthony Graham in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary court. State's witness is present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CAG

Defendant Curtis Anthony Graham in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Curtis Anthony Graham in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis Anthony Graham appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
